column5: Ive been busy at work putting in 6 days a week with only sundays off. These short days are really a pain when your in construction. The days go by so fast and it really seems like you get nothing done compared to the summer months. Hopefully finish this building by the weekend.      As mentioned most of my time has been spent at work and not on the water, although the fish have co-operated when I did get out. I wish I could write a more in depth report but I came down with the flu yesterday and have been in bed since. I just don`t have it in me right now. Anyways heres some pics from my last trip to a trib north of town.          My cousin Ted and I hit a river that we have only ever fished in the spring. Results were good and we didnt see another angler the entire day.              Ive only been out in the boat for steel once and it was only for 3 hours one sunday afternoon. Trolled spoons and minnowbaits on riggers. Also bounced some spawn which produced only small bows and an atlantic. This is where I plan on spending the majority of the remaining open water season.         One more open water report to come then its ice time!  TDunn
DOOOOOD....no in depth write up necessary...pics say it all.  Love the undewater shot.  I 2nd bring on the ICE!
Yeah what he says Thanks or sharing Leechman

i know how you feel about no time!  i bought a house and took possession nov 1st.  since i've painted the whole house top to bottom, installed new flooring in 4 of the rooms, and countless small jobs in the mean time.  since you're you're in construction, maybe you could take over for me so I could get out a little more?  nice report.
Beautifull, I would love to just drift those runs, the fish are a bonus.....lots of steel down south here but it's getting real hard to avoid the zoo
Great catches and pictures buddy. Great color on those fall fish.   Get yourself healthy and out there some more!
Nice Chrome - and shack buddy!  Love the underwater shots.  Cheers, Ryan
Those Atlantics are weird   looking. You sure are making the most of your available time.

Thanks for the great comments guys!  Doc- How about we go fishing instead!!!! LOL.... If you actually need a hand with something PM me and we can go from there.  Rod Caster- Very true about atlantics during the cold months! During the summer months they are bullets. Some call them The King of Chrome.....     TDunn
Awesome stuff Tyler! Georgeous rivers with no anglers and chrome... you're a lucky guy!  Aaron
anytime boss! just about every saturday i'll be headed north when you wanna chase some steelies.

I'm taking one more sick day today.....so its looks like I'll be working all weekend now... But the following weekend looks promising for both sat/sun off.... I'll let you know as we get closer to that weekend   TDunn
Wow...those fish are blindingly bright!  Nice touch with the Quicksilver hoodie too    Beautiful pics...as mentioned already, they say it all.
